items.title: Venezuela's Maduro to appear in US court, Trump says further strikes possible
items.summary: Jan 5 (Reuters) - Deposed Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro was due to appear ‌in a U.S. court on Monday after his weekend capture by American forces, with U.S. President Donald Trump leaving open the possibility of another incursion if ‌the United States doesn't get its way with Venezuela's interim government.  Read full story

items.title: MCMC Investigating Harm On X Over Alleged Generative AI Misuse
items.summary:
The Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) released a statement over the weekend saying that it is investigating online harm on social media platform X. More specifically, it is over the misuse of generative AI on the platform “particularly the manipulation of images of women and children to produce obscene, highly offensive and harmful material”. The MV88+ added USB, but relied on a cable and didn't mount directly to a phone or […]

items.title: EcoFlow’s newest + most expansive DELTA Pro Ultra X power station gets $1,300 exclusive savings to a new $6,999 low
items.summary:
Update 1/02: This exclusive low price is continuing into the new year for an unknown amount of time longer – don’t miss out!

We’ve secured a fantastic exclusive deal from Wellbots on the new EcoFlow DELTA Pro Ultra X Portable Power Station at $6,999 shipped, after using the exclusive code 9TO5ECO1000 at checkout for an additional $1,000 off. This all-new release from EcoFlow just hit the market last month and carries a $10,597 direct from the brand, whereas it starts lower at $8,299 here. The best of the discounts we’ve seen up until today was our previous exclusive price cut to $7,199. Now, we’ve gotten an even bigger exclusive deal for you with a total $1,300 savings off the going rate and $3,598 off the MSRP, landing it at a new all-time low price that you can’t beat anywhere else.

items.title: Lectric’s extended Holiday Sale returns up to $583 FREE bundles to the XPeak 2.0 off-road e-bikes from $1,499, more
items.summary:
Update 1/2: Lectric has announced that this extended sale is only lasting through the rest of the weekend – don’t miss out on the massive savings while they continue!

Lectric eBikes has extended its Holiday e-bike sale for an unknown amount of time longer, but will most likely continue into the new year. Many of the previous deals with up to $893 bundle savings are available, though two of the three models with price cuts have returned to their usual bundle pricing, like the XPeak 2.0 Long-Range Off-Road e-bike and a FREE $583 accessory package at $1,699 shipped. You can also find the standard XPeak 2.0 e-bike with a FREE $434 bundle at $1,499 shipped. These bundles with their e-bikes would normally run you $2,282 and $1,933 at full price, which is not only bringing back Black Friday’s same offers, but also gives you another shot at the largest bundles we’ve seen to date. Head below to browse the full lineup of offers while they’re still live.

more…

items.title: MOD offers continuing e-bike savings via its New Year Sale with up to $400 discounts starting from $1,799
items.summary:
MOD Bikes is continuing to offer rare savings on its e-bikes into 2026 through its newly launched New Year e-bike Sale with up to $400 discounts across its lineup. One notable low price returning this time around is on the new Groove SideCar 3 e-bike at $3,099 shipped, while its standard e-bike without the sidecar attachment is down at $1,799 shipped. This is the newest sidecar model to join the e-mobility fleet, having been released at the top of summer at $3,499. We saw it get its first discounts to the $3,099 low during Black Friday, while Christmas sales saw it down at $3,149. Now, you’re getting a second chance at the best price we have tracked, benefitting from a $400 markdown. Head below to browse the full lineup of deals while they’re still around.

more…

items.title: Pass pool cleaning to Aiper’s Scuba S1 robot for automated swim-ready waters while at $480 (Reg. $700)
items.summary:
Through its official Amazon storefront, you can jump on the off-season savings well ahead of summer for the Aiper Scuba S1 Robotic Pool Cleaner at $479.99 shipped. Normally going for $700 in full, we saw this model spending the final week of December at this rate before rising back in price for just one day. The deal here has only been beaten out by the drops to $474 back during Black Friday and the $470 low we spotted in early-to-mid-December, with you able to save $220 off the going rate right now, giving you the third-lowest price we have tracked. While this is a versatile robot for in-ground of above-ground pools, folks with above-ground swimming holes can save a bit more by going with the Scuba SE Cordless Robotic Pool Cleaner at $139.99 shipped, which has been serving my brother well for over a year now.

more…
